meanings.definition: A type of soil bacteria that forms symbiotic relationships with leguminous plants, aiding in nitrogen fixation.
meanings.sent1: The rhizobium in the soil helps the plants grow strong and healthy.
meanings.sent2: Farmers rely on rhizobium to improve the growth of their crops.
meanings.sent3: The rhizobium and the plants had a friendly chat about fixing nitrogen in the soil.
meanings.sent4: The rhizobium acted like a superhero, swooping in to save the day by fixing nitrogen for the plants.
meanings.sent5: In the garden, the rhizobium danced with the plants, creating a beautiful symbiotic relationship.

meanings.definition: The genus of bacteria that includes species capable of forming nodules on the roots of leguminous plants.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study rhizobium to understand how it forms nodules on plant roots.
meanings.sent2: The rhizobium genus plays a crucial role in the growth of leguminous plants.
meanings.sent3: At the bacteria party, the rhizobium was the life of the nodule!
meanings.sent4: The rhizobium spread through the roots like wildfire, forming nodules along the way.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the rhizobium looked like a tiny architect, building homes on plant roots.
